reviews.review: Greatest comic book movie of them all worth every bit of hype start to finish action comedy and drama

Awesome movie. Definitely a movie that is much better seen if you know your way around the MCU a bit. If you haven't paid much attention to the MCU, you might do well to brush up first; Avengers 1, Guardians of the Galaxy, Captain America: Civil War, Thor Ragnarok and Black Panther are probably the most important to see in preparation, but any movie you haven't seen yet you'd be better off watching first. There are some decent 15-20 minute long Infinity War prep videos that attempt to summarize the chronology of all 18 previous MCU films, too. I suggest this because one of the big criticisms I see is that the movie is too stuffed, not enough character development, too much to follow, etc. And there's good reason for that -- this movie presumes a lot of MCU knowledge and investment.

I've never been as anxious in my life than I was through this film then I left the cinema in a state of shock it has the right amount of everything funny, thrilling, nail biting and shocking for me the film is perfect!
I really liked the last 20-30 minutes of the movie, the rest was just average.
Exceptional. Must see two or three times. Impressive action and writing I've seen with the Marvel Universe. Something that stood out was there diet regiment. Seems everyone in the cast lost weight.

Incredibly fun, with a well-crafted villian and a multitude of heroes who share the screen very effectively, Avengers: Infinity War is a must see for any Marvel fan, regardless of level.  The more movies in the Universe you have seen, the more you will get out of the movie.  I cannot wait to see it again.

Appropriately epic and remarkably coherent despite the vast number of characters and locations but ultimately this film is just another tease. What really holds this movie is not the action or the effects, it’s the acting. The actors have grown into their roles and this is truly a great ensemble. As always the humor keeps this series afloat when the bombast threatens to become tiresome. Anyone else think Bruce Banner’s arc is a commentary on middle aged erectile dysfunction?
Enjoyed this movie. A lot going on. The end clip was definitely a teaser.
One of the best Marvel Cinematic Universe movies so far!
